intro: Centaurea cynaroides, commonly known as the common centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grasslands. Centaurea cynaroides is often used in herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
